7y_btVFrB6dzMzSzDzBcUA.text: Great food and very flavorful. Also the drinks are top notch and that's something your not going to expect from a little place in the corner of a strip mall. Decor is kind of ok but let's face it if you want affordable top quality Cajun food this is the place to go.

O8h52rQU2kaDBtWq-qJmug.text: This place rocks! It's right by my house so we just went there after church. I got the jambalaya and my husband got the meatloaf po boy. Both of us took home leftovers because the portions were so huge! Food was authentic and tasty!

MnA8gQ_L0NtGEmtGpwMIvQ.text: I read good things about Cajun Yard Dog so we decided to try it last night. Our server was great and the food was delicious. The tabasco strips were very tasty. We are glad Tega Cay is getting some better restaurants.

ApIh8qKvwkCoeI6KLrtclw.text: This is a good new restaurant in Tega Cay, SC.  I had the fried catfish and my wife had the fried chicken dinner. The fish was very well cooked and the breading was crispy with a nice hint of heat. The chicken was very crispy, moist and flavorful.  Our server was very friendly and professional.  We will definitely be going there again soon!

fHwQeG68J-BobSPCulOQuA.text: THE BEST CAJUN PASTA IVE EVER HAD! I am obsessed no other compares and I have been searching for the perfect one and I found it here! Servers are always so friendly and helpful when we come. Our favorite go to dinner place for sure!!

R3s6A0OGwzzXKAu5cS2h0w.text: One of my favorite places - I've been frequenting this place for as long as I can remember. I usually go to the Arboretum location but am excited there's a new location in Fort Mill (eventually I'll get there). My parents are Yankees that moved to LSU for college and they said it's at close as you can get in CLT. I've been to NOLA three times myself and agree. I usually get the crawfish etoufee, seafood gumbo or fried oysters. When they have blackened trout on special I get that. Their green bean almondine are the best green beans I've ever had. If you're feeling extra fat kid get the chocolate pecan pie. Servers are great and I love that it's the same crew since I started going here which usually is a good sign in how they treat their staff.

iMhHRe9MW8ss2XO3fiZctg.text: I had only eaten at the Arboretum location once and it was excellent. On our only other attempt, we left because the wait was so long. How sweet it is to have them right down the road from us now, with plenty of convenient parking!  Don't recall our waitress's name, but she did a good job without being overbearing. We went before the dinner crowd and were seated immediately.   The fried green tomato appetizers were excellent; fresh, crisp and not greasy. I had blackened meatloaf, smashed potatoes, and collard greens. Wife had crab cake, smothered cabbage and mac/cheese. All was excellent, just the way I remembered from the Arboretum location, without the bumper to bumper traffic.  The beer selection was very good, although they had sold out of Dixie Blackened Voodoo. No problem though, as they had a number of very good local and national craft brews to choose from. They had a number of wines to choose from, but I don't know much about wine.   Ambience was pleasant for a strip mall restaurant which just opened a couple of weeks ago, but we didn't go for ambience, we went for a good, reasonably priced dinner. We were not disappointed.

Eg3sNxz56D_j7EGAHZTgjg.text: Have been going to the Yard Dog for years and am surprised it is just now receiving attention on Yelp! The food is fantastic with daily specials. You can't go wrong ordering as I have never been disappointed by any of their offerings. The staff is just as authentic as their food and the decor adds to the experience. Looking forward to the next visit!

ZlKUZgWlbGCdN5xAS6wk8Q.text: Wonderful meal and excellent service!  Kiara and Lisa took great care of us.

4wbET2f_ncnM1SDuC2FG_Q.text: Well after looking at the reviews & having several people recommend this place, we decided to give it a try. Well to start it off I was disappointed in the crab cake appetizer for one you get a regular size cake with a lot of breading for $7.75. For this price I was expecting more crab meat & less breading or even 2 cakes. We also order the Chicken Jambalaya it was ok. We had a lot of recommendations to get the Red beans & rice but we were very disappointed in them. I would take Popeyes over Cajun Yard Dog. The fried okra was very good & not over cooked. The catfish bites looked very good but tasted bland. For the quality of the food the prices are a little high. This was our first time trying this place. Because the customer service was good & the food wasn't horrible we will try the CYD again but order different foods & see if I can change my review.

VIrzuac3PXbesoOZi7tJ1A.text: Wow. Exceeded my expectations. Loved the hand cut french fries. Cajun food was authentic. Great for kids too.

A8oN-TXSCX6k-qBoFcvn7g.text: I heard a few months back that Tega Cay was getting a "Cajun Yard Dog". I have never been to the Arboretum location, but I have heard great things. That, plus being a fan of Louisiana food, convinced me to give it a try... and loved it! I ordered the Crawfish etoufee and the Mrs got their special cob salad. We both really enjoyed the food. Cool restaurant inside. Now the place just opened up, so the typical "kinks" will be ironed out, but I am convinced this place will be around for many years!

5hesz5fNPvdnYuaOybVbsg.text: Really good!  We tried this place last weekend and the food was great.  Catfish, deviled eggs, potato salad - all awesome.  My friend had the pasta dish with shrimp and sausage and it was seriously good.  Very good service too.  We'll be back!

_3xqyxNpCoVUZbjdsubbRg.text: Visited Cajun Yard Dog tonight and had a wonderful meal - fried oysters with fries and smothered cabbage. Absolutely delicious! There were five in our party, and the others had fried chicken, catfish, shrimp and grits, and blackened meat loaf topped with shrimp (poor man's surf and turf). Everyone was very pleased with their meals. So happy to have this relatively new place in the neighborhood!

f1OEuuDlTMrvaWixCMig1A.text: Excellent food!  Tried the blackened meatloaf, crab cakes, and fried green tomatoes. All were very good.  We will be back.

2_56VFfVLGsg3FPplg4yQQ.text: Food is delicious. Really love the Jambalaya. Owner is super cool too. He came by and spoke with us several times. Very personable!

I4g5azQWxnwbYBEQqPGGyg.text: What a wonderful meal! I had the Shrimp & Grits with collard....YUMMMM....hubby had catfish....yumm again!  Be sure to sit in Quay's section......she 'da bomb!

pNkaYOfn4ZK6BhajPoWZ0g.text: Last night was our first visit to this Fort Mill based restaurant. I say Fort Mill based because there is the Charlotte location. It was busy but no wait time for a seat when we arrived at 6:30pm. We had really good wait staff. Quay was attentive but not over-bearing. Our meals were very good. My husband and I decided to have gumbo which really was a hearty bowl of soup with mussels on the side as well as shrimp (large and small), chunks of chicken and was delish. We thought it would be a cup of soup so by time we consumed every drop we were full. Our meals were great as we did the pick 2 choices. We both had fried jumbo shrimp and I had crab cake while my husband had catfish. All was good. My husband wasn't a fan of the cole slaw. Wish we had room in our tummies for desert so Quay suggested we start with desert next time :) That's what I'm talking about ... good looking out. We do like to venture to other restaurants for different dining experiences & not because our failure to return is based on bad experience.   The only critique would be to develop a good cocktail menu with established options. We ordered created cocktails but found them to be OK and as such the 4 stars.   The team at this restaurant worked well together in providing good service. Location is very close to our home so revisiting in the future is a definite. Maybe 5 stars if the cocktails are on point and the food is consistent. Something to look out for with next visit....

6lZrzNcOHOK9VwcBPVgNNA.text: Exceeded our expectations.  I had the seafood Gumbo and the Shrimp and Crawfish etouffe and it was very flavorful and enough spice to actually taste.  Was a little scared about the atmosphere but it was much more  family friendly than I thought.

8VouYHafro5Vl1wOMcC9XQ.text: One of my very favorite restaurants. Good food, friendly people, excellent service. Haven't had anything on the menu I didn't like and I've tried a lot of the menu!

oApNbaEsn1P74Iam1pAVXg.text: Spent over $100 on a Togo order for company after getting a recommendation from a girl I met shopping. Well 75% went in the trash. We had entrees and apps. Nothing was appealing. Maybe we should have dined in.

8EDLFXPArFjPORRVRfNeoA.text: Yum. Our fav restaurant in Charlotte, now in Fort Mill!  Maybe not as much character as the original location, but I'll settle for close to home and much more space.   In our first visit to this location, we had great service and great food. What more could you ask for?  The manager/owner came around to check on tables which is a dying art in restaurants today.   They always have wonderful specials, so definitely ask your server. And order the mac n cheese. Best in Charlotte!

EBgH2cZe4Ac4YbgKE5NXnQ.text: Great menu. Blackened mahi mahi very good. Smothered cabbage really good. Price is a little high for lunch (around $11  for entree and 2 sides)  Good bottled beer menu, around 8 beers on tap. Great service and personal attention from the manager. Definitely a nice addition to the area

fsVyLvlX0a4ljPebJCcTYA.text: bomb. i got the mahi mahi with mac and cheese and collards and i loved every single bit of it! it wasn't busy at all which struck me bc the food was delish. they had beer specials as well ;) can't wait to come back and try something else!

8dQqLBTT_tWd4XZ3pmkFRw.text: Wow great place and a great Cajun vibe. I've only had the shrimp and seafood jambalaya dish, but it was awesome! The only thing is the pricing. The menu that is on here with yelp must be an old one because there is about a $7 difference on site!! I paid roughly $20 for the jambalaya dish!! But great place, only thing negative is it is a little pricy for what you get

b_EeqTubpGV7_Ar9GO-IOg.text: Really bad experience at the Cajun yard dog.  Salad was warm, soda flat and my meal was room temperature.  I will never go back there again.  After we decided this was not worth it, we went to the Cajun Queen orderd the exact same meal and it was 100 times better.  The service at the yard dog wasn't much better.

Jf-7kxPYWuS_QwnOZc5Z7Q.text: Don't know how people are saying the food was bland, we thought it was awesome! Tons of flavor, everything made from scratch in house. Awesome shrimp and grits and crab cakes! All sides were delicious. Service was also fantastic. Came out very fast. I'm just visiting but my family will definitely be back.

b0aI5_N-Vq1hBNP3RSYlbQ.text: Absolutely love this restaurant!! One of my favorite places to eat in SC. There's two locations both have great friendly staff and laid back atmosphere. Good for fresh seafood and craft beers. My go to dishes are the seafood gumbo (which is done the correct way) collards, catfish tenders, and calamari. Huge portions and also a good place to bring the family.

jF1MPYVnSoRw8OdvN8XLfw.text: Finally tried Cajun Yard Dog last night.  I ordered the chicken and sausage jambalaya with green beans almondine; my friend got a seafood platter combo with friend oysters and barbecue shrimp with cucumber salad and potato salad. We were both disappointed.  My jambalaya had a couple of chunks of chicken and lots of sausage.  I would have preferred more chicken and less sausage to balance out the flavor so, especially since "chicken" is in the name of the dish on the menu.  My friend said her oysters and shrimp were OK but the sides were disappointing. We both agreed we wouldn't go back. The wait staff was very nice, the place was nice and clean but food was just so-so.

B9xqFh3NNj7ao59vajiFkQ.text: Everything I tried was DELICIOUS!! From the fried okra, shrimp pasta, devil eggs, down to the bread pudding!!! Ughhh I'm stuffed! I will definitely be back!

iWp19vcE69_YuubQwvNKyw.text: Good, not great. For starters, the place needs some cheer. It is very dark inside and kind of drab. Add some lighting and it would be more inviting. We came for a late lunch and spent $40 easily excluding tip, so a little pricey for lunch.  The okra is very tasty- light and not overly greasy. Kids meal options are slim, but you get good portions. The dessert looked good, but did not want to hit $50 for, again, lunchtime.  Despite our server being over assigned to multiple tables, she did a pretty good job. On a few instances, we had to remind her of a missing item/request. We would go back, but not a weekly type of place for the costs.

kr6QTVQHtFzHs-wtRRCXmw.text: This our second time here and we have enjoyed it! Apps-crabcake -excellent and calamari/artichokes/okra - very good (some of the best okra we have had)The shrimp and grits was very good! The Jambalaya was ok. The meatloaf was good and the swordfish was very good and cooked very well. The bananas foster is awesome (more ice cream, please)! The wait staff is friendly and efficient.

27n7c4fgF8n8D__2zrE5Qg.text: bridgett, gabby & the proprietor, al were awesome. unreal attutudes and so much fun. i am from nawlins and i know cajun food. this is the real stuff folks!  laissez les bons temp roule!

6EHs75IkxNachQNxqWNgtA.text: The seafood jambalaya is amazing! My husband alway gets the fried chicken. I've had many other dishes there and they all have been very good.

4cyxDqIOfromGNQMr2seCg.text: Wasn't impressed. They sat us near the back by the men's bathroom and the exit door. Which you could see the staff going out and in taking cigarettes breaks. The smell tells it all. The food isn't Cajun at all...we've been to restaurant that serves real Cajun food and this isn't one of them

v6XwEHLJfPV9Xm-ryUqh9g.text: Everything we had was good-jambalaya, po boy and catfish. Service was also prompt and knowledgeable.

ivhzzpkD8DFiCs4qrOnplA.text: Our second time to this location.  Menu and food was great, done right with large portions.  One of us had the fried oysters, the other had the  chicken and seafood jambalaya.  Had a slight mixup in one drink order, but they correctly it immediately.  Very pleased with our meals. Something struck us as strange, though.  As good as the food is, we did not see many customers at all on a beautiful Saturday evening.  Also, we both felt the staff was almost overly attentive (you don't see that these days!), as if they were trying too hard to please for some reason.  Maybe it's a fluke, but it struck us as unusual. Overall, great meal and service.

6fC0vzv72Y2TGMIFatfjFw.text: Best place in town to get REAL New Orleans food!! Went to one at Arboretum but happy to have one closer to home. Hubby & I like to stop by for a Blackened Voodoo Lager & a Po Boy. Our server Michael was great.

la1P0tFkj97IQ61QRdE-oA.text: We would go to the Arboretum location but it was a little far for us so when we found out they were opening up the Fort Mill location, I was super happy!  We went yo the Fort Mill location hoping it would be as good as their original location and IT WAS!!  I had the Chicken & Seafood Jambalaya and the hubs had Crawfish Etoufee - both delicious.  We finished our meal off with Blueberry & BlackBerry Cobbler.  Happy - happy!!

Tt0TkTo3g8Osijljzay7pQ.text: We were greeted by a very nice young lady. Service was great! We ordered Shrimp Po boy sandwich. They were ok, not special just ok! My daughter had shrimp etoufe! That was pretty good! So food was ok! But when I go to a restaurant I expect the restrooms to be clean. No paper towels, no hand soap! To me that's disgusting! I could see the kitchen from the restrooms and the kitchen was very dirty! Food all over the floor!

O-NpfjJlrLxwefsXO6dqmg.text: I am a huge fan of Cajun Yard Dog. Used to travel long distance to their Charlotte location. Great to have one of their restaurants in Fort Mill. Ate there tonight!   I recommend the Deviled Eggs to start (jalapenos in the mix for extra flavor). For the entre, get the golden-fried catfish with jalapeno tarter sauce. See a pattern here? Level it out with potato salad and mac and cheese. Boom! For dessert, get the chocolate pecan pie and a coffee. Done.   Cajun Yard Dog y'all!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Golden-fried catfish with jalapeño tarter sauce. The sides are potato salad and mac and cheese. Huge portions and great tasting food!

OyzkqZ51doh7TXdJ-dGQmA.text: The service was great. The people in the front of the house were so sweet and helpful. But the back of the house seemed unorganized. They came out making a fuss. The food wasn't authentic at all. DONT get the gumbo the rice had to be like instant rice. It was nasty. The bbq sauce for the shrimp and grits tasted like medicine. The shrimp was over seasoned w the wrong seasonings. The grits were dry. The catfish was so thin and crispy but it wasn't filling just greasy. The sweet potato fries were good tho lol

hzwAeKV9DicY0iDyWv4msw.text: I really liked the food here, so many things on the menu I haven't tries yet but it was delicious for lunch, need to go back soon. Service was quick as well.

uglatrDr7UD8Y23B6aRuTw.text: Good food, fun New Orleans cajun music playing and attentive service.  All spicy items can be served not blackened, salmon was a good choice.  Fries are not the best, too dark and not crispy, however, mac and cheese spiral noodles were tasty, the greens were spot on almost dare say best ever with bits of bacon and extra fresh and flavorable.  Shrimp combo was delicious, the shrimp was in a golden crisp batter, this will definately be a reason to return.  Several made on site desserts, including bread pudding, chocolate pecan pie and several other temptations.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Crawfish plus a Turbodog draft,  side collards.
Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Special of the day! Amazing.

bhNV8YVftCZkZYg__4X9MQ.text: Hubby and I have gone here about half a dozen times .  The last visit was not the best... it appeared they were short staffed in the kitchen, so the wait was pretty long. But -- the food was still great.  I gave 4 stars instead of 5 just for that visit. Other than that -- we have become HUGE fans of this place.  I was a little reluctant to try bc I'm not a huge Cajun fan, but glad we did.  Their specials have always been really good -- especially the pan fried trout with creole andouille and crawfish cream sauce.  They have good selection of fried platter options, including shrimp, oysters, and catfish and their app menu has some great options too.   The owner and staff are all super friendly and very eager to make sure your experience is a great one. We will be back!!

VXDhiSWFPTzmdFd1OCdvRg.text: Had a date night here.  I had chicken etoufee and wife had blackened salmon and gumbo.   Both dishes were tastefully presented and tasted good. I give it a 3 star b/c it was a little pricey for the atmosphere.  Also the etoufee did not appear to have REAL Rox sauce.   What I got looked like tan gravy versus the real dark, rich Rox sauce I love. Lastly there was no Dixie land jazz music which I like to hear when I'm at a Cajun restaurant.  Take a couple pointers from the Cajun Queen in charlotte and y'all be alright.

0dRn9jae9XniKYY93QUVAQ.text: Amazing staff, great food, love this place!!! Thank you so much for making us feel so welcome!

MJ51FdahIXUoUc6CqCwu_w.text: Tried to get lunch and after ten minutes of no attention in regards to menu order etc. I walked out while the place was at 40% capacity at best. No idea how the food is but the service seems to be horrible. No one seemed to care.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Fort Mill, SC, United States

ptw9Fnd6a_7RB9pVxlJosQ.text: I ate here the other day and it was amazing!!! We were welcomed as soon as we walked in the door and was seated. The hostess took our drink order immediately and brought over a drink menu when I asked about what specialty drinks they have. All of them were very reasonable priced ($9 or below). I ended up getting the Mardis Rita which was excellent. We ordered the Gumbo as a starter which could also be considered a side for the entrees. The gumbo was so good and some of the best I have had in the Charlotte area. For the entrees we ordered the Fried catfish and shrimp and crawfish etouffee. Both were amazing!! The only issue is the menu did not state you got catfish bites for the entree so it was assumed it would be a filet but it was still so delicious there was no reason to complain.  I will definitely become a regular here even if I just come in for a bowl of Gumbo. Can't wait to return!!

zcA6laGX0tofWZgOOQeohw.text: By far the most amazing cajun restaurant ever!!! We started with jalepeno deviled eggs which were TO DIE FOR!! Then my husband and I both had the chicken cordon bleu  which isn't your traditional chicken cordon bleu but it was a 10 outta 10!! I had the sauteed veggies and mac and cheese and my husband had mac and cheese and potato salad. The sides are fresh and also not traditional but to die for. We finished with bananas foster which was so amazing I can't even put it into words. This is by far one of my top 5 favorite restaurants in the WORLD and we have been all over. A+ Cajun Yard Dog. Keep it up!!

x99gc150ntTAXMFfEx8_oQ.text: I can't stop talking about their grits!  The atmosphere/decor sets the mood for Cajun, our waitress was attentive, and the food looked and tasted great! We started with the catfish bites (great breading!), he had the crab cake poboy and I had the shrimp and grits! Delicious! For dessert, he had the red velvet pound cake and I got the bread pudding...we were both very satisfied with our selections! The portions are great and the price was fair for the quality and quantity!  We will be back!!

L6kIVJNt-kghL5-ejEmy6Q.text: Place is  pretty good for a quick meal. The owners are originally from Louisiana and therefore the recipes are very authentic. I had the  ettoufee; it was just okay.

tj1oZTl7MYo1ZX-ymTLjnA.text: The kitchen is very dirty and the food is over priced. Being a past worker I would not suggest anyone waste their money eating here. It's recipe based Cajun food that misses the mark and the authenticity. Blahhhhh

d04K9OD2iaZAaC0rOmi-uQ.text: Delicious!!!  Appetizer #1: jalapeno deviled eggs.....very good!!!!  Appetizer #2: seafood gumbo...freaking delicious!!!!  Dinner for the wife: shrimp and grits with side of fried okra....she loved it!!!!  Dinner for me: crawfish creole with side of collards...the bomb dot com!!!!!  Dessert:  double chocolate pound cake...wow!!!!  Service by Bridget was excellent and the owner, Al was very nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Crawfish creole with collards. Awesome
Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Shrimp and Grits with okra. Delicious
Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Gumbo appetizer.

CgAuQOqv-ThnyD7TT2CrNg.text: How awesome to have really good, authentic, fresh Louisiana cuisine so close to home! We've been here several times since February and are never disappointed. We've had the jambalaya, etouffee, gumbo, salmon, trout, collards, okra and look forward to sampling everything else, New favorite place for spicy, flavorful Cajun food, c'mon!

0uvwwyaDOm1uCNvJAySGtA.text: Not the best Cajun food I've had, but still very good. Owner seems to take pride in creating a great restaurant. Great addition to a Fort Mill area that's greatly lacking food diversity.

60m7aC4-PPwuea8T0QJeOw.text: If you like New Orleans cuisine you'll love this place. The etouffee is REALLY authentic and tasted delicious. We started with the jalapeno deviled eggs - great flavor. They have a good beer and wine selection. The food was a bit slow to come out but the service was very attentive without being overbearing. We will definitely be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Bread pudding. Yum!
Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Fort Mill, SC, United States

KL2gB139ya3ciiqr5h4WKg.text: I've been here four times and the food has always been excellent. I love Cajun spices and they do it perfectly. The bartenders are always nice and the service is always great.

12KJ3CN7eQmD6eLRonfNuQ.text: Good food not amazing Cajun food. If everything was 3-5 bucks cheaper they would have MUCH more business. Nearly every negative review is because of the price. I will pay 18$ for a large Bbq shrimp but I want to taste the garlic, lemon, Cajun spices and taste that it is homemade. I'm not saying that this place doesn't do their Cajun food homemade but it seems to me a lot of the stereotypical "Cajun" food taste a little to generic not like it was made from scratch. Just my opinion check it out and decide for yourself. I'll take my business to Cajun queen im Charlotte where you pay 18$ and lick your plate clean.

5g-MWQTABph-s-D4CqpuRw.text: This place could be mistaken for a fried food Louisiana sports bar... But it is much more than that.  This is most likely the best quality food in the area.  The right mix of authentic with their own twist will keep you coming back.  Our Fried catfish bites came out hot, fresh, and perfectly seasoned and prepared.  If you order smashed potatoes ask for the gravy.  I ordered blackened meatloaf which was fantastic, but my wife's shrimp poboy was equally as amazing.  We finished it off with hot blackberry cobbler that was freshly prepared and served with cold vanilla ice cream.  I left uncomfortably full, but every bite was worth it.  Give this place a shot.  You'll have a new favorite.

1q_HYntNUyJmV9TNTzz5dw.text: After taking over the previous dive of a sports bar, I was curious to see what the folks associated with CYD had to offer Fort Mill. The interior looks slightly different after they took some time to re-do it. I wouldn't consider it to be a sports bar anymore, more of a family restaurant. Even though they still have the flat screens from the previous bar, they are not open late like a sports bar.  They definitely disappoint on the food side of things. The waitress talked us into the catfish "bites" as an appetizer, as you can see in the photo - "bites' is not an adequate description! You could definitely consider these a meal by themselves! They were tasty indeed.  I ordered the meatloaf with side of collards and red beans/rice. The meatloaf was very good! So huge I forced myself to stop eating half way or I would need to be rolled out to my truck! Jeez. My friend is a po-boy connoisseur and he came back with two deep fried thumbs up after chowing down on the shrimp pro-boy.  They do not offer draft beer, but they have a very small list of bottled beer including some Louisiana favorites. They bar can also assist in select liquor drinks. (Editor's Note: Unless you;re craving a vodka/red bull, they do not stock red bull.)  Simple. Cajun. Goodness. I would return.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Meatloaf. Comes with two sides, shown here with collards and red beans and rice.
Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Catfish &#34;bites&#34; appetizer  ... for &#34;bites&#34; they are HUGE!

Ob2hfMjyYs8L08pmAubG7g.text: This is my second time here and I was not impressed at all with the food. The crab cake was not a real crab cake and the food had no seasoning on it. This will be the 2nd time that I have been disappointed in their food. I will not be coming back again. The service was good though.

vfZGISRDV_AQ9OO32ObIsA.text: As the name would imply this is a Cajun restaurant in Fort Mill, SC. All of the food that I have had from them has been good except for one time when a new cook was in training. They have a different special every day and they serve the lunch menu until 4 PM. They have a full bar with a decent draft beer selection. I have always received good service at this restaurant. It's the same great food as the Arboretum location without the crowd!

PDkIKe7Z40xmfOdPsIA7fw.text: I haven't been here in a long time and I've been taking about it to my wife for a while and we decided to go when we were in the area. Not only did I grow up in Charlotte, but I grew up in New Orleans too. So, I would call myself a Cajun food expert.   There aren't that many places in or around Charlotte that have Louisiana/New Orleans level Cajun food and I always considered CYD to be one of them. However, on this trip, I just wasn't impressed. Years ago, I would swear this was the best place in town, but not so much now. Not to mention the prices are a little on the high side. With the food competition cranking up, you have to have really great food to charge high prices.   It's always sad to see a restaurant you use to call the best not live up to its expectations, but it wasn't terrible either. The service was great, the atmosphere was great, it's just the food was decent and the prices were too high.   I'll save my next Cajun food craving for when I'm in New Orleans.

TBKmxMjqpE7yi7k0_3lPfg.text: It was good and cooked to order, but not cheep.  Kids meals $6.00 plus side and drink; but no milk! Blacken salmon with two side- dressing good sweet fries not so good.  Shrimp po boy- good job with it mac and cheese- good Kids loved their fried shrimp

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Blacken Salmon with steamed vegs and sweet potato fries.
Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Kids fried shrimp and mac and cheese
Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Photo bomb fried shrimps and white rice

NRJJnJ1z7uSN2wxvC-vRXw.text: This place is a new favorite of ours.  Food is out of the world,  service is fantastic,  and the atmosphere is fun.   Don't miss the shrimp and grits (even the appetizer is awesome).  In fact, this restaurant is so good that my wife and I left there planning what we were going to order the next time we come

99TyDyh-gfFRIYnhGyJJQA.text: The food was good and the service friendly. That means a lot, so I would come back. However, the atmosphere inside wasn't that great. They have a concrete floor that has been painted. They have plain wood chairs and older style tables. Feels like a 60's diner or that old family restaurant that you never liked as a kid. We ordered 2 margarita's and I didn't care for them. Seemed to have little Tequila and the flavor tasted more like orange juice than Margarita. Perhaps they make their own mix, because they had several specialty ones. Probably my mistake to not have ordered the speciality. For an appetizer we had Calamari Okrachokie. It was tasty. Some fried Calamari, Fried Okra, and Fried Artichokes. I mean, fry anything and it's good right? I had Shrimp Ettoufee and it was tasty, pretty spicy. My wife had blackened Salmon, she said was good. My daughter got Fried Chicken, which was very good. My other daughter got a swordfish and fried shrimp, again good.  So, if you want some Cajun style food this isn't a bad place. However, don't go here for the atmosphere. It has a mix of old diner and sports bar feel to it.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Swordfish and shrimp combo
Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Shrimp Ettofee

KthgtBMrh5cZFYiiudg8HA.text: Interesting place We got the shrimp etouffee and the hamburger steak.  Both were ok.  I thought the "gravy"  for the etouffee tasted like gravy that would have been great for the fried chicken, but unless you put the "Cajun" dog sauce on it it didn't taste anything like Cajun.   The collards were chopped and not that great.  Btw the okra was awesome.  Good service but the food .....ok

QxOTL5VqpfakSBdNpBMEkg.text: I was very interested in visiting CYD (Cajun Yard Dog) simply because Madison's was gone and they're new. Which is great for this area! I ordered the deviled crab cake and Okrachokie minus the okra... (I am an okra snob and frozen just doesn't cut the cake, but that's just me). What was left was artichokes and calamari. I also LOVE red beans and rice. This version contained andouille sausage.   How was it? The calamari was fried with the artichokes and that's where it goes wrong. Calamari cook extremely fast, so fast in fact that the breading is often under cooked while the calamari over cook. They come out a bit rubbery and the artichokes were soggy. The breading was a bit bland. Which was a bit of a shock.  When I was looking the menu over I was rather intimated by all the Cajun and jalapeno ingredients, but I shouldn't have been. The heat is warm and builds, but stays rather mellow. Sauce is king here, delish!   Next up is the red beans and rice. I got here at 7:45-8pm and they close at 9. I am saying this because it is rather late to be ordering food. The rice was perfect. The seasoning was spot-on! Really good flavor here. However, the sausage tasted like it had been cooking for about 24 hrs, way over cooked and a bit grainy textured. The beans were good, maybe a bit dry, but again, the flavor was as really great!   Lastly, the crab cake. I saved this for last because it was my favorite! I am a Floridian originally and this deviled crab cake took me back to my home state. They are thick (possibly a bit too thick) but taste just like the thinly battered deviled crab I grew up with. Don't expect it to be a Maryland crab cake... this is purely the Southern deviled crab cake.   I'll will be returning to tray actual dinners and at a better time.   Update! I returned to CYD this evening and got the red beans and rice again, the crab cake again, and this time a kids shrimp with Mac and cheese. All the items were cooked to perfection! The crab cake was superb for a Cajun crab cake (which is served deviled crab style, I love it!) I also ordered fried pickles, which are new to the menu and they are probably the BEST fried pickles I've had in a long while! They are dill and crunchy! I say this because pickles are wet and that usually makes the batter coating a bit soggy, not the case! These are crunchy dill and the breading stays crunchy also! The sauce has just enough kick for you to know it's spicy, but I was still able to keep dipping.  I am happily updating my three stars to 4! Can't wait to try more of the seafood!! Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Fort Mill, SC, United States
Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Fort Mill, SC, United States. All Cajun and spicy foods! Looks amazing! Haven&#39;t tried anything yet.
Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Fort Mill, SC, United States

_56Ik6UGQNxz-nVq5xGYVw.text: Very laid back child friendly atmosphere! Our waitress was very sweet and attentive. The food was satisfying but I cannot give this place 5 stars because nothing was extraordinary about it.  Definitely worth going to for lunch!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Fort Mill, SC, United States

xzQt1LJfBxbCX5xIxvnWHw.text: Stopped by this place with the fam, told me it was really good which it was. The service was great to us. I ordered the fried shrimp Po-Boy with sweet potato fries and mac and cheese. I enjoyed it. They had a nice bar in there as well, nice place to stop by!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Fort Mill, SC, United States
Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Menu
Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Menu

RV0QST0rUi1dA64akm8L0Q.text: OHMYGAWD this place is amazing!!!! Fast friendly service and immaculately seasoned food!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Fort Mill, SC, United States
Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Fort Mill, SC, United States

N85TIDOV6OH_wd0a2_l9Vw.text: We have been here a few times, and have never been disappointed.  The food has always been on point, excellent service from the staff, and we absolutely love the atmosphere!  We haven't found anything that we haven't liked.  Definitely try this place out if you haven't!

dxii5oxLk-jlpMTIyLEhlA.text: Nice staff. Horrible food. Shrimp etoufee looks like dog food gravy poured over rice. Taste was nasty, people that gave good reviews doesn't know how good should taste.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Fort Mill, SC, United States

LzGmpmLaKtnxrvz0Uu9tBg.text: This place is amazing. We love the New Orleans food. The service is great and the staff is so friendly. We love the Charlotte location as well but there is always a wait. The Ft Mill location is much larger so there is no wait. Give it a try you will not be disappointed.

61iu783BIz9Y2mwyPDHsBA.text: If you haven't had battered fried mushrooms here...you haven't had fried mushrooms! The Gumbo is bursting with flavor and just the right amount of heat! The portions are large and everything is made from scratch! If you like New Orleans cuisine, you'll love Cajun Yard Dog!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Fort Mill, SC, United States
Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Fort Mill, SC, United States
Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Fort Mill, SC, United States

L_PH5e-rmx55Ompyy4V63Q.text: Tried the pineapple cider for the first time. It was delicious!! Try the catfish Mac and cheese with collards!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Fort Mill, SC, United States
Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Fort Mill, SC, United States

LlcWpd2HvC3oqJ1SnhDmSQ.text: New location but the same great food. Now CYD has the best Cajun fried chicken in two states  Great location and it's double the size of the CLT location. I hope they open the comedy club next door again and give Fort Mill/Tega Cay a night spot.

G1PRtSNFY8JL2wknj7EoXg.text: Food is always delish! Fun casual atmosphere. Good beer available and bar options. We always sit in meg's section and she is awesome!

V_YuL07qQNEGSynAxI512Q.text: Yay! Cajun Yard Dog is here! Great service and wow what a great job they did remodeling the location. It really makes a difference for the shopping center.  As for the food, it's just what I expected excellent. Clasic Cajun favorites. Things not to skip out on:  The salad with honey mustard dressing. The honey mustard dressing is a scratch dressing with garlic and a mild chili pepper that give it an excellent flavor almost like a pepper jelly.  The fried catfish- super light and flakey you cannot miss with this.  The fried chicken on the bone. You will have to wait a bit longer but it is very worth while. The chicken is pressure cooked with a unique light flaky batter.  Red beans and rice. My favorite side has a nice flavor and comes with huge chunks of jambalaya sausage on top.  Chocolate pecan pie. Done right. The pecans are chopped which makes for a naturally sweeter pie and they are plentiful. Best pie around!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Catfish and red beans and rice
Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Salad with honey mustard dressing
Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Chocolate pecan pie

KWK8NAf9VcJ5VKpGe0HdXQ.text: I have to admit that I didn't pick this place, as I usually steer clear of Cajun food. Please don't ask me why, I honestly have zero idea. It's just never on my radar.  I came in on a Saturday night for dinner with a friend. It wasn't crowded and quickly seated. I ordered the Berry Habanero because, if you read the ingredients and you like spicy, you would too. It definitely had a kick, not nearly as spicy as I thought it was going to be. But be warned, one of these drinks is probably enough. I was only halfway finished with it and was feeling "nice."  We shared the BBQ shrimp appetizer. The shrimp were huge and the bbq sauce was different with a little spice over grits. I ordered the catfish with a side of grits and sauteed veggies. I basically inhaled the veggies. They weren't overly seasoned with a great texture, not soggy, not too crispy. Grits, great! I didn't even need to add salt. The catfish was nice and crispy with a flavor of buffalo, not spicy like buffalo wing sauce but the flavor, and they give you a huge portion.   I definitely recommend this place, and get the

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Berry Habanero
Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Catfish with grits
Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Fort Mill, SC, United States

j0prI9jejgjZOGeOlzg09A.text: Went for Father's Day and the people were nice but the food was tasteless  I had the shrimp & grits Daughter had chicken and fries

6yvjkcGN9Xa3KibydaZl5w.text: We went here on a Sunday as my son choose CajunYard Dog to celebrate his birthday. The place was not busy as only one other table was seated.   We ordered an appetizer of Calamari, two orders of blackened mahi & catfish; blackened mahi and BBQ shrimp; fried shrimp and a fried chicken dinner. Four out of the five dinners came out slightly burnt. The fried catfish was a dark brown and all dried out. There was very little fish; It was mostly dried, burnt, crispy breading. We all agreed It was the worse catfish we've ever had. The fried chicken was the same: overly fried to a very dark brown, dry and nearly unedable. My wife was unable to eat much of it. I can't fathom why a cook would send this out to customers.  The BBQ shrimp is not BBQ in the traditional sense but rather cooked with hot spices. My daughter does not like spicy food and would not have ordered it if she'd known. Our server was sympathetic and bought her out a replacement order.  Our server agreed that the food was overcooked. However, we did not want to wait for another 25 to 30 minutes to eat as the fried chicken takes about 25 minutes to cook/make so we just told her to bring us the check.   Service gets 4 stars as our server was friendly and really wanted to help but said she "was not able" to do what was needed and help further. I interpreted this as management does not allow her to compensate us. I guess a few dollars is more important to the owners than customer satisfaction.   I am so unhappy as we did not get what we paid for. It was money thrown away. They also need to update their menus as they have beers listed on their menus that they have not had in almost a year.     I reached out to Cajon Yard Dog on their web site asking to speak with someone but they never got back to me. This just reinforces the notion that they do not care. I am one to always give a place a second chance as everyone has off days. However, in this case, the food was so bad we do not plan to return.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Inside Cajun Yard Dog

YK9h0q1ZgqsAEuWJfNrOCA.text: First time here. Definitely won't be back. Food was on the bland side. I didn't get pics but the it should be called macaroni NO cheese. I've never had a more bland macaroni with no cheese in my life. My crab cake was only okay. I guess I wasn't expecting a unflavored panko breaded crab cake. So to get past the unflavored food I called my order in and went to the bar to pick it up. The lady at the bar was extremely nonchalant as if I was bothering her just by coming in. On the phone they did tell me that they were closing at 7:45. Which was odd because their normal hours are much later than that. Unsure as to why they were closing early. $47 later I've decided I'll never be back.

0cNaOdZ19aunsE8K6esYkA.text: We have been here a couple of times since it reopened as Yard Dog. The decor is brighter with a mardi gras theme. Good place if you are craving fried seafood, this is the place to be. The combo is the best deal. Two entrees for $12 plus two sides.  We have had the combo with fried catfish and blackened breast with mac and cheese and smothered cabbage, fried oyster po boy, and fried okra. I am not much of a fan of mushrooms but their beer battered shrooms are AWESOME!. They advertise the sauce as horseradish but it is more of a combo with thousand island dressing and it is quite tasty.  Beers are decent with a few local craft brews; however, they probably need to clean their lines a bit more often. The floor for some reason was sticky as well. Tip: check your bill before paying as the charges may not necessarily match the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Blackened mahi and chicken, cheesy grits and red beans and rice
Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Fried oyster po boy
Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Fried catfish and blackened chicken

xtPYTekNoJ6uUNo3sKcdIw.text: I don't even understand how this place has 4 stars !! 1st time and last for sure! Service was terrible but again so was management so. Can't  blame the unhappy server too much. Kids meal fish soooooo spicy , I get it it's a Cajun place but kids meals should not be spicy or at least we should be warned. Husband had the shrimp po boy with was decent not spectacular just decent and he paid extra to get jambalaya as a side , well they should put that on the kids menu because it was flavorless and bland , he had 2 bites and didn't even want to bring it home. I ordered the crab cake po boy , it was ice cold inside and gross . The only thing that was ok were the sweet potato fries. Place was empty on a Saturday at 6:30 pm so I'm pretty sure those 4 stars are fake! We love Cajun food and were soo disappointed today!

LUufcvtbin9F07dARkue3A.text: We've been here several times, the food is hit or miss. Last time we went half of our group really enjoyed their meal and the other half didn't. We had all different meals so it seems like there is inconsistency with their quality. I personally liked their shrimp po boy, but their French fries were awful.

X09RI_SEnB2hOpw2Jl05Zg.text: The fried calamari was wonderful, I had the fried green tomato BLT po boy and my wife had the fried catfish po boy and both were great. Service was fast and friendly. They also had a good selection of craft beer on tap. I would definitely recommend!

WGgh-JtZ_U1Oc1kg6171jA.text: I learned about Cajun Yard Dog from Yelp, and have been wanting to check it out based in the positive reviews. I went for dinner on a Saturday night, and was surprised there were only 2 couples in the entire restaurant when we walked in. We were quickly seated by our waitress who came back with menus and asked what we wanted to drink. So far so good.  There was sleepy soft rock playing I think from the 70's or early 80's. It was not fitting for the environment. Here's an idea...how about jazz music?  One of the 2 other tables didn't like their food and sent it back. Out comes an older gentleman who asked the woman if she wanted something else. She politely declined, but he wouldn't give up and kept asking her multiple times and she seemed annoyed.  We were missing silverware, and when it came the fork looked old and bent. It should have never made it to the table. I ordered a shrimp po boy and jambalaya. The po boy was ok but the jambalaya was mushy and bland.  I was only there 30 - 45 minutes and could identify numerous areas needing improvement. I doubt the owners do not care about customer reviews as there are no responses to customer comments, but if you are reading this I suggest you look at management.

IHGDuk9j2oznN47EtuNyZw.text: I am so excited about the awesome new restaurant! Finally something new and different in the general area.   First - they have made changes since it was Maddie's. New paint, lots of decorations making it a fun space to hang out in. I had been trying to dray my fiance here since it opened. Apparently he thought it was some form of hot dog place. What? No, definitely Cajun food without a hot dog to be seen on the menu.  We went late one Saturday for dinner and it was only moderately crowded. Our waitress was friendly and prompt with all of our orders. We started with the jalapeno deviled eggs which were just okay. Far too much salt for me to love them. I ordered the crawfish etoufee because I like crawfish but hate dealing with the shell. Etoufee is one of my only options to enjoy crawfish. I upgraded my side to gumbo and had it come out first because why wait any longer than you have to for gumbo? The gumbo was a full delicious bowl with just the right amount of spice. My etoufee was also yummy and came out on a huge plate. Even without a side or app it was definitely a two meal amount of food.   The real winner of the night was my fiance's delicious chicken and seafood jambalaya. It had all sorts of seafood in addition to chicken and sausage. It also came with a touch of heat and the restaurant provides three different hot sauces to kick it up a notch if you want.   While the weather definitely called for some spicy rice based dishes on this visit I was also excited to see lots of blackened fish and other lighter options. I love places that offer a variety of choice. It looks like they also rotate fish based specials as well!

g9G4pkXa2SDZfz5duvtBBw.text: Ate here for dinner. The food was good, but service was slow and it wasn't even crowded.  The slowness was on the kitchen's end, not our server's fault- he was quite apologetic that our meals took so long. This place offers all the New Orleans classics like gumbo and Po Boy sandwiches, and there aren't really any other places in York County to get the Mardi Grad experience. 4 stars for food, 2 stars for service, so split the difference and call it 3 stars.

43GR697Lm7tQ4Q4zGVHdag.text: If I could I would give these place 3,5 stars but unfortunately I can't so 3 stars will do. They have a nice decoration that reminds of New Orleans. My husband was raised in New Orleans and he mentioned this place so many times that finally we went check it out. We were sat right away and our waitress was very sweet.  Their menu has many options, however it is pretty pricey for the kind of food they serve. Considering that the place was very busy the food didn't take too long to be served. The food came and I was kind of disappointed with the amount that was served. We ordered a combo with 3 options (fried shrimp, fried fish and crab cake) we also had two sides, fried okra and cheesy. The food was just okay, nothing to brag about. They also charge fo With that being said the probability of us going back is very small.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Fort Mill, SC, United States

zDDD4kXeucGuiKN1toLitw.text: So, the best part of our meal was our waiter (Conner), who couldn't have been more personable or attentive; it's a really good thing we didn't get either of the other two - they looked like they'd wandered in from a construction site. The chef looked even worse.   The fella and I started with glasses of $4 house wine, and for dinner, I got the shrimp fajita special - which came with a dirty straw wrapper in the giant dollop of sour cream - and the fella got a half fried oyster, half fried shrimp plate. He said the fried oysters had no taste, and he was disappointed it didn't come with tartar sauce. Each of our plates came with two sides, which was honestly too much, but my rice was super dry and tasted like Uncle Ben's, and well... the straw wrapper. As others have said, the prices are WAY too high for what you get. And Louisiana is misspelled on this Cajun restaurant's menu.  This place has so much potential, but it just feels like a sad, old, rundown, dirty bar.

NzQ04BBiaItKA_kv9Fe36A.text: The food here is delicious, the service spectacular, BUT do not order the blackened salmon during lunch if you are looking to receive more than a 3oz filet. I don't think I have ever been to a restaurant that serves 3oz as an entree... I could type about this for the entire review but I will move along :-D  Lunch items ordered: Jalapeno deviled eggs: just regular deviled eggs with pickled jalapenos in the middle of the plate Blackened Salmon - cooked perfectly but very small, seasoned just right. Almond green beans- yummy, but a little to overcooked Collards-DELICIOUS, I will just order two servings of this next time lol HOUSE SAUCE- I put this on the deviled eggs and they definitely made them better, worthy of the "not your mama's deviled eggs" title after the addition of the sauce.  I will most likely visit the original location In Charlotte, NC . Maybe the dinner size salmon will be at least 5oz. ?

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Choose two lunch entree . Blackened chicken and bbq shrimp
Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Jalapeno deviled eggs
Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Fort Mill, SC, United States. house sauce is addictive !

uZ3g7TW-WR7Vjqtkqdop4Q.text: I've eaten at this location a couple times before and had great food and service. This time, our service was still decent, but our food needed help. It took a little while for it to come out and there were only 3 other tables in there in a week night. It looked good as usual and came out steaming, but when we both dug in, our food was cold on the inside. I had the chicken and andouille jambalaya and creamy grits. Both items look hot and were hot on the outside, but cold on the inside. Almost like my plate had sat there too long and then had been microwaved. We'll probably try this location one more time and if it's the same, we'll just go back to the arboretum location. We've never had a disappointing visit there.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Fort Mill, SC, United States

PM8iJLrwcg89UhC7HoLb8A.text: First time going here. I really enjoyed it. I got andouille sausage with shrimp pasta. Soooo good. The sauce on the pasta was amazing. The service was good as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Shrimp and grits. Mac and cheese.
Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Andouille sausage with red beans and rice

ZvNUoLfAcJbyQggQFKv4yQ.text: First trip last weekend and got an order to-go.  I had the fried chicken with fried okra and mac & cheese.  I wasn't impressed.  The chicken was over cooked and closed to being burnt.  Mac & cheese was like store bought.  The okra was actually pretty good.    I was hoping for a new best place to get good fried chicken.  Unfortunately, I've definitely had better even at fast food.  I may go back and give them another try, get something different.  Just not the chicken.

Qw8ynMEod3TiaT0Q8aPRrg.text: My husband and I are from Louisiana. Here's what we ordered: fried green tomatoes, side of red beans and rice, crawfish etouffee and shrimp & grits. The shrimp was big. Grits were cooked perfectly. The sauce was amazing and tasted JUST like my La Marsala sauce so I'm pretty sure this restaurant and I are making similar essence (spice base/selection for the dish). It was like I was back home!! My husbands etouffee was amazing! Prefect heat on both dishes. I recently visited Cajun Queen and the atmosphere is definitely what you're paying for. This is the real deal!!! LOVE IT!

4gDBGXbVoZSZIuuV1u8XFg.text: This is what Tega Cay needed! Good Cajun food in a casual atmosphere. It's a much needed improvement to the previous Madison's on the corner, a neighborhood bar with mediocre food.   The bar area stayed along with the tv's so you can still watch a game and grab a draft craft beer. I appreciate that they are currently carrying Windy Hill cider.  It was my birthday. We were seated quickly. Our waitress was friendly,  but seemed to be rushed. So there was no "Have you eaten here before?" conversation or let me suggest a few items. And throughout the evening several different servers stopped by to check in on us. We went with a shrimp and grits appetizer to start. It was good. The grits had a good flavor, but I tasted a slight bitterness that tasted like parmesan cheese which didn't quite fit the dish. But the shrimp were cooked perfectly and paired well with the grits. My husband ended up ordering a larger portion as his dinner.   For my main course, I had the shrimp and chicken etouffe with a side of gumbo. The portion was huge. The etouffe was spicy and full of flavor, just how I like it. I'd definitely come back for this dish. The gumbo was okay.  It was pretty thick and didn't seem as flavorful as the other dishes. I'd probably opt for the seafood gumbo next time instead. I also wish some bread was served with the meal. I like to sop up every bit of sauce.  So, we finally got to dessert and asked if they did anything for birthdays. The waitress wasn't sure but later came out with a piece of cake and said "Happy birthday." The cake tasted like a lemon pound cake and it was divine. It was heated up and just melted in my mouth. It was moist and sweet, but not too sweet.   There's still a lot of things on the menu I want to try and I'm happy this is right down the road from me.

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Yummy Cake
Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Chicken and Andoulli Gumbo
Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Fort Mill, SC, United States. Shrimp and Chicken Etouffe

PV7fYHCXT_Y3N_Yc82ghLQ.text: Ordered through DoorDash a few times and figured I'd take a friend here because I thought it was great! I was sadly mistaken. Disappointed that they were out of okra but I understand that much. Macaroni was tasteless and bland and Tabasco strips didn't taste the same. What really threw me was watching the waitress lick her finger and dip it into a pitcher or tea to taste whether or not it was sweet. Dinner was definitely over for me then.

Mz0j1zkabw7JpvFUWiXaIw.text: The service was great and the food came out quickly. He food was great. I will definitely be back. The fried shrimp and oysters were perfect, battered just right!!!!

nSrgCl42LouzHHXwN6J1jg.text: Weve made 2 trips.....grand opening day, good service, good food, a bit pricey...we had catfish app, etoufee, and tabasco strip sandwich with cabbage....only thing to note is that tabasco chicken, had no spice at all....2nd trip on Thursday, i had meatloaf po boy, while good, very little to no spice to it....supposed to have a sauce, but none detected...she had blt po boy and cabbage (yes, she loves the cabbage!)..blt was very good....2 issues on this visit ( none with food)..when we arrived, only several filled tables, we asked for booth, host said they save them for larger parties???, they seat 4.... we were sat at a 4 place table!....to add to that, after denying us a booth, we pointed to a table, he said, no, we will seat you "here".....we said, ok, wow......2nd issue wife noticed while going to restroom, with open view to kitchen, noticed floor was very dirty....she said, "filled with food".... we will give another shot, but will wait a while to hope they "get the bugs out"

OehX8ts-WzzB763mofvErQ.text: Food was ok . Very disappointed with entrees . Just didn't taste that great . Deviled eggs were good . Services was also very good

5gvMdU7PUwsNmVgXq9Oeqg.text: Ate here the other day.  Greeted as soon as I opened the door.   Got a appetizer and a beer.   BBQ shrimp was cooked right and the beer was cold.    Staff is attentive and friendly will be back.

ITbVyVvXpCK9e-Oklj0VDA.text: First time here and not a fan. Had to order to go since my toddler was not feeling good.  First of all, $6 for a kids meal was a little high, especially when the only "healthy" option was simply buttered noodles.. . Anyway, it said it came with a drink, however I was never offered one. I had to ask and didn't find out there was a $1 upcharge for milk until my bill came! I would have happily got my daughter juice, but there was never a mention of an additional charge for milk!  I ordered the Cajun Cobb salad for myself but asked for no bleu cheese. When I got home I realized that while there was no bleu cheese, the dressing that I was provided with was bleu cheese dressing! Wouldn't it just make sense to offer a different dressing if the customer said no bleu cheese?! $18 for this... no thanks

eIn8qUKcSRQ_yfKOBMKJIA.text: I had lots of anticipation coming here, I love Cajun food. Owner and staff were very friendly. However, food came up a little short. It needed more spice and more flaire. The mac n cheese, my bellweather, was tasteless and cold. They salted and chilled my beer glass - not what a craft beer drinker wants. The creole was good, but lacked spice and kick. Shrimp was good. I will try again.

Zvw7CizxrNZ5_SKLLnNIwA.text: This establishment is nothing like the original. My family and I frequent the Providence location, but visited the Fort Mill location twice because of proximity to our house. The food of all our dishes have been lukewarm...precooked. The jambalaya was soggy, the shrimp and andouille pasta came without shrimp and sausage, and fried chicken which takes 20 minutes to prepare was cold. This location may damage the reputation of the Providence location. We will not be back but will take the drive. Sad.

nK1BrpHYA-C9qylWxZymNg.text: First time here. Surprised by the quality of our lunch. Staff very friendly. Chicken waffles great. Mix of Cajun and southern foods. We all enjoyed the food and experience. I'll be back for the shrimp and grits next time.

ZnGBNbT2VqrNDAkIZUslGg.text: My husband and I ate at Cajun Yard Dog for the first time tonight. We thoroughly enjoyed the food, and the service was excellent. The owner or manager ( he sounded like a True Ragin' Cajun'!) checked on us several times while we were eating. My husband had the Shrimp Ettoufe with mac and cheese, and was very happy with the entire meal. I had the barbeque shrimp (not really barbeque, but in  butter w Cajun seaoning), the smothered cabbage and fried okra. Everything was very tasty. The only reason I did not give the Yard Dog a 5 is because my cabbage was not hot and barely warm. We had the chocolate pecan pie and sweet potato pound cake for dessert- yum for both! Not an inexpensive meal, but a real treat.

Y17A6kNYvHX8er4yfcRucw.text: Let me preface by saying that I am a New Orleans born and raised native living in the Carolinas.  That being said, were this restaurant in Louisiana they'd be tarred and feathered and run out of town.  My husband and I started our meal with the chicken and andouille sausage gumbo. It was good. It did not taste like any gumbo I've eaten before, but it wasn't a bad soup if I forgot that they consider it gumbo.  My husband ordered the shrimp po-boy and I ordered the red beans and rice with andouille sausage. His shrimp were undercooked, definitely under seasoned and drowning in mayonnaise.  Water has more taste than these shrimp.  Red beans and rice from Louisiana is often considered creamy.  Red beans are cooked with ham and sausage until they fall apart and they have a creamy consistency and a pink color.  These beans needed several more hours of cooking.  The sausage in the beans tasted boiled.  The beans themselves were spicy and that is the nicest thing I could say about them.  To be honest, if you want decent red beans and rice outside of Louisiana go to Popeyes, at least they are creamy with some flavor.

747iPy5fp0Guq1tbIRn--A.text: So happy to have a yummy Cajun restaurant close by in Tega Cay! I coordinate a monthly lunch group which numbers between 20 and 30 people and we love checking out local restaurants. Cajun yard dog wasn't known to many of my group but we were made to feel at home right away and the service was spot on. Lisa took care of our section and she had all sorts of good recommendations and advice that made our dining experience even better! I had the crawfish etouffee with a side of green beans almandine and both were delicious. My mom had shrimp and grits and I had a bite (since I can because I'm her daughter) which was very good. The sweet potato fries were a little tired. I went around the table and checked with everyone and they were all happy with their orders and felt it was good value for the amount of food that we got. Besides the great service, what also impressed me was that the manager/owner came over a number of times and made sure that all was wonderful. I'm looking forward to going back and trying out other tempting Entrees. Also the desserts looked awesome! If I wasn't so full I would've split one with my mom, but then I would've had to waddle back to my car and that isn't pretty. All in all we had a wonderful lunch and I would highly recommend Cajun yard dog for delicious Cajun food!

3tFBMCxmwUjudU6hhbc1yg.text: Recent open, but not great and pricey   Bartender seemed engaged, but is poorly trained and no knowledge of the food, heritage, etc  Lots of Hispanics trying to cook Cajun   Good music

fZk_6H9B4g-s46fW78XZOg.text: I have the pick 3 with catfish and double oysters. And it came with two sides. Which didn't come out until 10 mins after the fish and oysters?.?. The fish tasted like the freezer, the sweet potato fries were old and the Caesar salad was not a Caesar salad. It had blue cheese and cooked red peppers which is not normal. And when I let my waitress know that I didn't like the salad. She did nothing. I will never come back.

34SxcBYRLnM7JAo8zWQexw.text: This is just a great little find with great N'Orleans-style food. Had the blackened trout. Mr. Bill had crayfish. Shared an appetizer of fried green tomatoes. I normally don't care for collard greens, but they were delicious. You have to try the bread pudding, if you have room. Pleasant staff. Good food. What more can you ask for! Oh, yeah, great variety of libations. Thank you for a new Tega Cay eatery that's good!!

iSiEkOHh_hHRAD2JupdM6w.text: This spot is FOR REAL. I've been up and down this menu and have yet to find something I don't like. The service has always been good, and Al (the owner) is always present and asking how everything is. Great local spot, and True New Orleans flavor!!

aZg9A7f66yeaPDP6U5nZww.text: Had lunch Togo there the other day. The portion was good and the homemade sauce was bomb.  I definitely want to bring my family here to dine in for dinner.  The only issue I had was with the soda it was sorta flat.  Other than that I'm glad to have a new place to eat!

yynn5Hu01Tx6OT2WmMKPog.text: Great place in Tega Cay with authentic Cajun food. I had blackened Mahi, collard greens and pickled beets and my nephew had the jambalaya and fried okra. All of it was fantastic!  Met the owner, Al, who guarantees the best meal or your money back.

Tn_nKYOv5thPlZjEtkPv0A.text: Was a little unexcited to try the new Cajun Yard Dog, but since it is close to home, we decided see what it is all about.  We are SO glad we did.  Have been there 4 times and not once have we been disappointed.  Portions are very generous, food is cooked to perfection and their specials are out of this word delicious!  Not knowing anything about Cajun Yard Dog, we anticipated a step above fast food and we were so shocked to find a pleasant atmosphere, great service and fabulous food.  Has become a regular stop for us.

dUzgqSAReUcamY_01BktoA.text: Geesch, where can you stop by for the BEST shrimp/grits, collards, and ice cold beer??? The Cajun Yard Dog. This place will not disappoint. Ask for Alexandria too. She was very informative/helpful. Enjoy!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cajun Yard Dog - Fort Mill, SC, United States. 6 plump, succulent shrimp in the most buttery scrumptious grits! Delightful.

NbCsRMlPz46EEyJNlzv9KQ.text: I love this spot. Great food and service. Specials everyday [maybe weekdays only?] Plenty of room. Recommend

mIukoaeFCOymL-wE7soW8A.text: Listen, the food here is great. The employees very attentive and nice. My problem is the absolutely ridiculous side charges for something that should be a part of the meal. $10.95 for a lunch of meatloaf I can live with, what is a normal side with meatloaf? Why yes mashed potatoes, well if you want that here it's $2.95 extra so now we are at basically $14.00 for lunch. Get my meal and its a little tiny, tiny bowl of potatoes, ugh, ask if I could have some gravy for the potatoes was told sure but thats $1.00 extra. Are  you kidding me. Absolutely crazy. Will certainly reconsider ever going here again. It's like booking an airline flight where you have to pay extra for everything.

IpX0HF8UNlwT3IIgvH4i4A.text: I know from experience that it's a server's worst nightmare to have a table of 25 be seated!  Our service at the CAJUN YARD DOG was impeccable; the servers were friendly, attentive and knowledgeable.  Our drinks and food arrived in a timely fashion and everything was hot and delicious, with generous portions. Again, that's just short of miraculous when you are talking about a group of this size!  We all were impressed and delighted.  Well done, CAJUN YARD DOG!  Thanks for making this celebration a special night to remember.

EO5AhHHJLWlf7_7k-aeMjw.text: We went here tonight for some po'boys and couldn't be happier with the restaurant.  Service was great, food was just like what we had in Cajun country.  Highly recommend this place!

VQ2xwBGaHfqzeQTWzVMH4g.text: We have been to the other location at the arboretum and loved it.  Food is wonderful but the service was sloppy.  I'm hoping it's because they have only been open a few weeks and it will get better.  Check it out if you and you won't be disappointed!

Noz-umXAU5IKiElBhCqadQ.text: Yuck is all I can say. The service was good but that's where it ended for me. I ordered the hamburger 'Po Boy' style. It was way over cooked (I ordered it medium) and was not juicy whatsoever. The side I ordered was the sweet potato fries. They were overcooked and limp with little flavor. I feel like I totally wasted my money. I won't be back.

YEN54F0G1K2DYJepoW1_PQ.text: We are happy to see a new restaurant in Fort Mill. We enjoy the Tabasco chicken and chicken cordon blue. The Mac and cheese is yummy, but don't care for their other sides. The owner is always so sweet.

W6CVTzRccrs3Y839ECj6_g.text: The food was good and the service was great.  The only thing that I didn't love was my fish had a lot of bones that were not removed.  It was very obvious that they were there and the cook was careless.  Also, I think we were seated close to the back area where employees can take their smoke breaks, it smelled very strongly of smoke.  It was only an issue for me because I'm sensitive to cigarette smoke.

Im_zs1nPO-IinNSPBG7DYA.text: Grossssssss! Walked in and immediately smelled like someone was smoking in my face. The bartender said "it's probably the owner" ummmm Ok that makes it even worse. Left immediately.

mJ5brKENpoBqPtnEhK8GAQ.text: So excited to see one of our favorite restaurants here in Fort Mill. The food is great just like the other location. However, the service could stand to be improved. We have been here three times and each time we came in service was slow. The last time we came in three people standing behind the bar, three tables needing to be cleaned. We sat down at one table only to realize that it needed to be wiped off also. Thank goodness the food here is so fantastic.

5-K6zL2ODQTvLfGyF1PN2A.text: Went for lunch had the fish it was to strong like it was old. The owner was rude he made our group feel very uncomfortable. Won't be back

Qb2q7lECmPjFj60kvcUaVQ.text: Just ok....  service was slow and we arrived around 4:45pm on a Thursday.  Cucumber salads was not fresh and lacked flavor.  My guests liked the catfish po'boy and jambalaya.  Fried oysters were ok.  Definitely not New Orleans grade, but ok.
